com.characterforming.jrte.base

Class BaseParameterizedEffector<T extends ITarget,P>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.characterforming.jrte.base.BaseEffector<T>
      • com.characterforming.jrte.base.BaseParameterizedEffector<T,P>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The effector target type
    P - The effector parameter type, constructible from byte[][] (eg new P(byte[][]))
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEffector<T>, IParameterizedEffector<T,P>

    public abstract class BaseParameterizedEffector<T extends ITarget,P>
extends BaseEffector<T>
implements IParameterizedEffector<T,P>
    Base IParameterizedEffector implementation class. The newParameters(int) setParameter(int, byte[][]), invoke(), and invoke(int) methods must be implemented by subclasses. Subclasses should use decodeParameter(byte[]) to decode strings from parameter byte arrays using the gearbox Charset.
    Author:
    kb

    • Method Detail

      • newParameters

        public abstract void newParameters(int parameterLength)
        Description copied from interface: IParameterizedEffector
        Create a parameters array with capacity for a specified number of compiled parameter values. The implementation class must call setParameters(Object[]) with the result.
        Specified by:
        newParameters in interface IParameterizedEffector<T extends ITarget,P>
        Parameters:
        parameterLength - The size of the array to create

      • setParameter

        public abstract void setParameter(int parameterIndex,
                                  byte[][] parameterList)
                           throws TargetBindingException
        Description copied from interface: IParameterizedEffector
        Compile and set a parameter value from effector arguments specified in gearbox transducers. The parameter value, which may be a scalar or an array, is to be compiled from an array of byte arrays. The implementation class must call setParameter(int, Object) with the result.
        Specified by:
        setParameter in interface IParameterizedEffector<T extends ITarget,P>
        Parameters:
        parameterIndex - The array index in the parameters array P[] to set with the parameter value
        parameterList - An array of parameters, where each parameter is an array of bytes.
        Throws:
        TargetBindingException - On error

        Returns:

        public abstract int invoke(int parameterIndex)
                    throws EffectorException
        Description copied from interface: IParameterizedEffector
        This method is invoked at runtime when triggered by an input transition, passing a parameter index to indicate which parameter object is to be used in the invocation.

      • setParameter

        protected final void setParameter(int parameterIndex,
                                  P parameter)
        Subclasses must call this method from setParameter(int, byte[][]) to set the compiled parameter value in the the base class parameters array P[].
        Parameters:
